newsitem.title: DENMARK: Goldman Sachs cuts Danish Phoenix stake.
newsitem.headline: Goldman Sachs cuts Danish Phoenix stake.

text.p: Goldman Sachs International said on Monday that it had cut to below five percent its stake in Danish roadbuilder Phoenix Contractors, subject of a takeover battle between two rival suitors.
Goldman Sachs announced on January 31 that it held 5.5 percent in Phoenix, complying with Copenhagen Stock Exchange rules demanding disclosure if a stake rises above five percent.
Monday's statement said only that Goldman Sachs no longer had a disclosable interest and did not say how many shares it had sold or to whom.
Norway's Rieber and Son and Danish Icopal have each offered 876 million crowns for Phoenix, which has advised shareholders to sell to the Norwegians.
